ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that two residents were able to engage in sexual activity on three
separate occasions. Resident were not properly supervised on these
occasions.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the Recipient Rights Officer (RRO) and he reported that he was made
aware of the allegations on Saturday, May 9, 2020 and he spoke to the two
residents regarding the allegation. He said the two residents admitted they engaged
in sexual activities on three occasions. He said neither resident could recall what
staff was assigned at the time of the incident but was able to recall that the acts
occurred on the afternoon shift. He said the two residents admitted that the three
sexual acts were planned. He said the two residents said they were in the bathroom
together without staff supervision. He said he later received information that one of
the residents recalled Staff 1 and Staff 2 were on the wing while the interactions
occurred in the showers. The RRO reported he received information from Resident
A’s therapist that she did not want to get Resident B in trouble but that she was
saying no to Resident B initially before being peer pressured into the acts with
verbally demeaning statements and name calling if she did not perform the acts. He
reported that Resident A did not report this information to him when he asked her if
she had been forced or convinced to engage in the acts.
I interviewed Resident A, age 17, and she said she performed oral sex on Resident
B when staff was not paying attention on three different times on three different
days. She said on two different days she went in the shower and Resident B was in
the shower and got in the shower with her and the sexual acts occurred. She said
on one occasion she went into Resident B’s bedroom when staff was not in the area
and performed oral sex on Resident B. Resident A said she did these acts because
she wanted to and not because she was forced. She identified Staff 1 and Staff 2 as
the two staff that worked on all three shifts when these acts occurred. She said she
stopped because resident B told staff on her.
I interviewed Resident B, age 17, and her story was slightly different from Resident
A’s. She reported she was in the shower and Resident B came into the shower and
said she was in the bathroom. She said Resident A got into the shower with her and
that Resident A performed oral sex on her. She said it lasted a good ten minutes.
She said she did not feel forced into letting Resident A do this to her. Resident B
alleges that the act occurred twice in one day. She said she left out of the bathroom
after the first sexual act and re-enter the bathroom a second time and Resident A
committed the act with her a second time. Resident B said the act occurred the third
time in Resident A’s bedroom. Resident B said the first time Resident A asked she
3

said no but that Resident A kept begging her and she gave in. Resident B said she
did not know what staff was working the shifts during those times.
Both Residents reported they were separated on different area of the building and
that they were no longer friends. Both residents reported they felt safe at Vista
Maria.
I interviewed Staff 1 who works the afternoon shift. She reported she has been
working for Vista Maria (VM) since July 2019. She said she did not know anything
about a sexual act between Resident A and Resident B. She said the residents are
monitored all the times. She said the residents go to the bathroom one at a time.
She said if two residents are in the bathroom, she usually sits in the bathroom with
the residents and this is also the procedure used when the residents are taking
showers.
I interviewed Staff 2. He said he has been working for VM for fifteen years. He
denied that he observed or saw anything regarding the allegation. He said the
residents are in “line of sight “at all times and this was common practice. He said
there are two staff on the wing at all times.
.
The building ratio is two staff per seven residents (2:7).
A police report was file regarding the allegation. The Log number is 20-5837.
Dearborn Police Department came out to the facility and took a report from both
residents regarding the allegation. Both residents reported they were not forced to
do these sexual acts and that it was consensual.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
4

ANALYSIS: There were no incident reports written because staff denied they
witness these sexual acts between Residents A and B. There
were no video tapes reviewed because VM does not have video
recording in Donna Maria Hall, and showers would not be video
recordings in the shower.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported they are monitoring the residents at
all times and that the residents are in “line of sight.”
Resident A and B both reported they engaged in sexual acts
(oral) on three different occasions, twice in the bathroom shower
and once in Resident A’s bedroom. Resident A said the sexual
activity stopped because Resident B told on her.
A police report was file regarding the allegation. The Log
number is 20-5837. Dearborn Police Department came out to
the facility and interviewed both residents regarding the
allegation. Both residents reported they were not forced to do
this sexual act and that it was consensual.
The residents could not provide the exact dates the sexual acts
occurred but was adamant that the three sexual acts occurred
on the afternoon shift. Based on the residents’ interviews, it is
established that staff did not provide the continual supervision of
the residents.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend Vista Maria Specialty Residential - Donna Maria Hall license remain
unchanged upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan.
